com.jaunt_api.component
Class Form

java.lang.Object
  com.jaunt_api.component.Form

public class Form
extends java.lang.Object

A class representing a HTML/XHTML form, with methods for finding, retrieving, and setting form fields of various types (eg textfields, dropdown menus, checkboxes, hidden fields, etc), as well as methods for submitting the form and generating request permuations.

Field Summary
 Element element
          The form element that begins the form.

          Retrieves the method of the current form, denoted by the method constants in HttpRequest, or if no method was specified in the form, returns the default HttpRequest.GET

          Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission without pressing any particular submit button.
 HttpRequest getRequest(FieldComponent submitButton)
          Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the specified submit button.
 HttpRequest getRequest(java.util.regex.Pattern submitLabelPattern)
          Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the submit button who's label matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression Pattern (using Matcher.matches).
 HttpRequest getRequest(java.lang.String submitButtonRegex)
          Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the submit button who's label matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression (using Matcher.matches).
 java.util.List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations()
          Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.
 java.util.List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations(java.lang.String submitLabelRegex)
          Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.

          Retrieves the select (dropdown menu) component that has the specified (case insensitive) name.

 FormComponent insertComponent(Element currentElement, int index)
          creates and adds a FormComponent to the Form based on the specified Element, inserted at the specified position index (or at -1 to append)
 void removeComponents(java.lang.String name)
          Removes all components found that matched the specified name (ie, value of the name attribute).
 void select(java.lang.String label, java.lang.String optionRegex)
          Completes the dropdown menu or menu list (ie select component) that has the specified text label (case insensitive, space insensitive) with the option(s) that matches (using Matcher.matches) the specified (case insensitive) regular expression.
 void setAction(java.lang.String action)
          Sets the action attribute of the form to the specified url.
 void setCheckBox(java.lang.String name, boolean checked)
          Sets whether the first checkbox with the specified (case-insensitive) name is checked and throws an Exception if the checkbox was not found.
 void setHidden(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the first hidden field with the specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no field with specified name exists.
 void setMethod(int method)
          Sets the method (GET or POST) to the specified method constant in HttpRequest.
 void setPassword(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the first password field with the specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no field with specified name exists.
 void setRadio(java.lang.String name, int n)
          Sets the radiobutton at index n and with the specified name to be 'checked' and deselects all onther radiobuttons with the same name, throwing an exception if no such radiobutton exists.
 void setRadio(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the radiobutton with the specified (case insensitive) name and (case insensitive) value to 'checked' and deselects all other radiobuttons with the same name.
 void setSelect(java.lang.String name, int n)
          Sets the nth menu option with the specified (case insensitive) name to 'selected', and deselects all other options in the same select tag, throwing an Exception if no such menu option was found.
 int setSelect(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the first menu option with specified (case insensitive) name and (case insensitive) value to 'selected' and deselects all other options in the same select tag if the select tag does not have 'multiple' keyword; throws an Exception if no such menu option exists.
 void setTextArea(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the textarea with specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no such button exists.
 void setTextField(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
          Sets the first textfield with the specified (case insensitive) name to the specified value and throws an Exception if no field with specified name was found.
 Response submit()
          Submits the the form without pressing any particular submit button; no name-value pair contribution from any submit button is added to the query string.
 Response submit(FieldComponent submitButton)
          Submits the the form by pressing the specified submit button.
 Response submit(int submitButtonIndex)
          Submits the the form by pressing the submit button specified by its index, with indexing starting at 0, and throws an Exception if specified submitButton is not found.
 Response submit(java.lang.String valueRx)
          Submits the the form by pressing the submit button who's value matches (case-insensitive) the specified regular expression (using Matcher.matches) and throws an Exception if the specified submitButton does not exist.

Field Detail

element

public Element element
The form element that begins the form.

Constructor Detail

Form

public Form(Element formElement,
            java.util.List<Element> componentElements,
            Document doc)
Creates a Form object from the specified form element.

Parameters:
formElement - an Element that represents a form tag.
componentElements - a list of form-component Elements (eg select, input, textarea elements) owned by the form, or null.
doc - the html/xhtml document containing the form.
Method Detail

getComponent

public FormComponent getComponent(Element element)
Retrieves the component who's first element is the one specified.

getElement

public Element getElement()
Returns the form Element for this Form.

setMethod

public void setMethod(int method)
Sets the method (GET or POST) to the specified method constant in HttpRequest.

Parameters:
method - either HttpRequest.GET or HttpRequest.POST.

getMethod

public int getMethod()
Retrieves the method of the current form, denoted by the method constants in HttpRequest, or if no method was specified in the form, returns the default HttpRequest.GET

Returns:
either HttpRequest.GET or HttpRequest.POST.

setAction

public void setAction(java.lang.String action)
Sets the action attribute of the form to the specified url.

Parameters:
action - a fully qualified url.

getAction

public java.lang.String getAction()
Retrieves the action attribute of the form.

Returns:
the action attribute value or if no action attribute exists, returns url of the document (sans querystring), or null if the document was not retrieved via url.

insertComponent

public FormComponent insertComponent(Element currentElement,
                                     int index)
creates and adds a FormComponent to the Form based on the specified Element, inserted at the specified position index (or at -1 to append)

Returns:
the component created from the specified element.

getComponents

public java.util.List<FormComponent> getComponents(int targetType)
Searches for form components by component type (as denoted by the form element type constants in FormComponent).

Parameters:
targetType - element type constant in FormComponent.
Returns:
a list containing FormComponents of the matching type, or an empty List if none were found.

getComponent

public FormComponent getComponent(java.lang.String name)
Retrieves the first form component that has the specified name (ie, value of the name attribute).

Parameters:
name - case insensitive value of the name attribute.
Returns:
the first FormComponent with the matching name and type, or null if no matches were found.

getFieldComponents

                                                         java.lang.String valueRegex,
                                                         int targetType)

removeComponents

public void removeComponents(java.lang.String name)
Removes all components found that matched the specified name (ie, value of the name attribute).

Parameters:
name - case insensitive value of the name attribute.

                     int n)
              throws NotFound

name - the case insensitive name.

setSelect

public int setSelect(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String value)
              throws NotFound
Sets the first menu option with specified (case insensitive) name and (case insensitive) value to 'selected' and deselects all other options in the same select tag if the select tag does not have 'multiple' keyword; throws an Exception if no such menu option exists.

Returns:
the index of the option that was selected, with indexing starting at 0.
Throws:
NotFound

getSelect

public SelectComponent getSelect(java.lang.String name)
Retrieves the select (dropdown menu) component that has the specified (case insensitive) name.

Returns:
the first select component with specified name or null if no match was found.

setSelect

public void setSelect(java.lang.String name,
                      int n)
               throws NotFound
Sets the nth menu option with the specified (case insensitive) name to 'selected', and deselects all other options in the same select tag, throwing an Exception if no such menu option was found.

Parameters:
name - the (case insensitive) name,
n - index of the menu option, with indexing starting at 0.
Throws:
NotFound

select

public void select(java.lang.String label,
                   java.lang.String optionRegex)
            throws NotFound,
                   MultipleFound
Completes the dropdown menu or menu list (ie select component) that has the specified text label (case insensitive, space insensitive) with the option(s) that matches (using Matcher.matches) the specified (case insensitive) regular expression.

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, space-insensitive, left-side label.
optionRegex - case-insensitive regular expresion to match the text of one or more options.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

             throws NotFound,

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, space-insensitive, left-side label.

NotFound

choose

public void choose(short labelOrientation,
                   java.lang.String label)
            throws NotFound,
                   MultipleFound
Selects the radiobutton or checkbox with the specified label.

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, space-insensitive label of the radiobutton or checkbox.
labelOrientation - Text orientation constant indicating the position of the label with respect to the radiobutton or checkbox.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

unchoose

public void unchoose(short labelOrientation,
                     java.lang.String label)
              throws NotFound,
                     MultipleFound

Parameters:
label - case-insensitive, space-insensitive label of the radiobutton or checkbox.
labelOrientation - Text orientation constant indicating the position of the label with respect to the radiobutton or checkbox.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

submit

public Response submit()
Submits the the form without pressing any particular submit button; no name-value pair contribution from any submit button is added to the query string.

submit

public Response submit(int submitButtonIndex)
                throws NotFound
Submits the the form by pressing the submit button specified by its index, with indexing starting at 0, and throws an Exception if specified submitButton is not found.

Throws:
NotFound

submit

public Response submit(java.lang.String valueRx)
                throws NotFound,
                       MultipleFound
Submits the the form by pressing the submit button who's value matches (case-insensitive) the specified regular expression (using Matcher.matches) and throws an Exception if the specified submitButton does not exist.

Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound

submit

public Response submit(FieldComponent submitButton)
Submits the the form by pressing the specified submit button.

getRequest

public HttpRequest getRequest()
Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission without pressing any particular submit button.

getRequest

public HttpRequest getRequest(FieldComponent submitButton)
Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the specified submit button.

public HttpRequest getRequest(java.lang.String submitButtonRegex)
                       throws NotFound,
                              MultipleFound
Returns the HttpRequest object corresponding to a form submission made by pressing the submit button who's label matches the specified (case insensitive) regular expression (using Matcher.matches).

NotFound

                       throws NotFound,
                              MultipleFound

addPermutationTarget

public void addPermutationTarget(java.lang.String name)
Tags the form component with the specified name (ie the value of its name attribute) as a permutation target.

See Also:
getRequestPermutations(), getRequestPermutations(String)

addPermutationTarget

public void addPermutationTarget(java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.Object[] values)
Tags the form component with the specified name (ie the value of its name attribute) as a permutation target.

Parameters:
values - an array of values through which the tagged component should be varied to generate the request variations (this parameter should be null if the values are already contained within the component).
See Also:
getRequestPermutations(), getRequestPermutations(String)

clearPermutationTargets

public void clearPermutationTargets()
Un-tags all elements tagged for permutation.

getRequestPermutations

public java.util.List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations()
Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.

See Also:
addPermutationTarget(String, Object[])

getRequestPermutations

public java.util.List<HttpRequest> getRequestPermutations(java.lang.String submitLabelRegex)
                                                   throws NotFound,
                                                          MultipleFound
Generates a list of HttpRequests that represent all the requests made by permuting tagged components through their values.

Parameters:
submitLabelRegex - regular expression used for (case insensitive) matching the label of the submit button (using Matcher.matches) to contribute name-value pairs to each permutation.
Throws:
NotFound
MultipleFound
See Also:
addPermutationTarget(String, Object[])
